ComponentExtraMetadata.ComponentDescription:
You will need to do the following:

#1 : creat a glocal collection for tabs on App start and then have each of the LeftNav take that as Nav Items.
#2 : Assign each tab\item an ID.
#3 : have a global variable called varInitialSelectedId put that as input to all LeftNav's in your app
#4 : on Each screen OnHidden action set the variable
------------------------------------------------------
Advanced: you can alter the collection at anytime to dynamically add tabs

ComponentManifest.Description:
You will need to do the following:
#1 : create a global collection for tabs on App start and then have each of the LeftNav instance take that as NavItems.
#2 : Assign each tab\item an ID.
#3 : have a global variable called varInitialSelectedId put that as input to all LeftNav's in your app
#4 : on Each screen OnHidden action set the variable
------------------------------------------------------
Advanced: you can alter the collection at any time to dynamically add tabs
ComponentManifest.Name: LeftNavigationBar

CustomProperties.Name: OutSelectedID
CustomProperties.Tooltip: This property will output the ID that is selected. This is consumed by the screen to tailor the content based on the ID

CustomProperties.Name: InitialSelectedID
CustomProperties.Tooltip: ID is used to synchronize what is shown as selected.This property helps when you have many menu items mapping to one screen

CustomProperties.Name: SelectBackgroundColor
CustomProperties.Tooltip: Back ground color of the selected item
